alert.note: Alert for Burlington; Monmouth; Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 27 at 3:50PM EDT until May 27 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Ocean County in southern New Jersey... Northeastern Burlington County in southern New Jersey... Southern Monmouth County in central New Jersey... * Until 430 PM EDT. * At 350 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Tabernacle to Wharton State Forest, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Toms River, Lakewood, Jackson, Presidential Lakes Estates, Lakehurst, Pemberton, Wrightstown, Allenwood, Six Flags Theme Park, Cedar Glen West, Leisuretowne, Jacksons Mills, Chatsworth, Cassville, Vista Center, Wharton State Forest, Presidential Lakes, Woodruff, Ramtown and Cedar Glen Lakes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 14 and 27. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 91 and 97. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
